comment: I absolutely loved prof Watts, so kind! His feedback made the class feel interactive and he was a fair grader. The work was all related to the content that was so interesting and engaging. There was a discussion post due at the end of each week and a final project.I loved the format of the class! Definitely the best language substitute!

I had a wonderful time learning about SPAN 1002. Professor Watts delivered amazing lectures during every class period! He is very caring, and funny; I am sure you will enjoy his class. There are weekly 2 - 3 tareas on connect. Also, there are 3 Exams, a couple of projects (Projects), and also a couple of in-class speaking assignments.

If you are hesitant about taking this class don't be! You have about 1-2 assignments a week that do not take long to do at all. He post his recorded lectures and gives you enough resources to do the assignment. He makes his class very fun to learn and I would definitely take him again in the future.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: take him! he has assignment every week but it is so easy, it will take less than 2 hours. there is 3 project it is long but easy. very easy grader
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Respected

comment: Definitely should take if you desire an understanding in Spanish. Very interesting and fun class!!

Best Spanish prof ever! I had so much fun in his class. In class is majority talking to your classmates in Spanish which is a great way to learn, but could be intimidating to the less social. Online hw due before each class. He wants you to succeed & enjoy learning about Spanish culture. Definitely a class you need to attend each day. I loved him!
He is very funny and genuinely wants you to learn.

Okay, this course was set up so confusing. I missed a couple of assignments because his instructions were unclear or he would post the assignments late. The one time I tried to email him, he was very rude. He did respond fast though. The amounts of assignments every week were a lot. Take at your own risk.

He didn't post any assignments on the left side of d2l, it was all under different folders. It's hard to see what is due when. He also posts random connect assignments throughout the week without saying anything. Took forever to respond to emails.The exams/projects were very easy. Some of the HW was difficult, but overall not a hard class.

This was the most fun Spanish class I've taken! He is passionate about Spanish culture & language. He wants you to succeed & enjoy Spanish. Homework is online + due before every class. He offers extra credit. Every class included speaking time w/ classmates (so if you aren't social maybe avoid). Overall, I Loved it! Take him as your profe!!

My experience with Alan Watts is best described as mediocre. It is hard to succeed in his class unless you already have a firm foundation in the Spanish language. He announces quizzes and tests in class in Spanish so if you struggle with understanding the Spanish language I do not recommend.

Professor Watts was a good teacher for those who love the Spanish language and have a passion for it. If you are only taking this class because it is a requirement, get ready to struggle. He only tells when the quizzes will be in class and in Spanish, so if you miss it you're doomed. There is also a lot of homework.

I love this professor, but if you're very advanced in Spanish, he'll accuse you for cheating or ask you how you know things. He's very by the books, and does not follow his syllabus at all. A lot of his assignments you aren't aware they're due. His classes are enjoyable, except when it's early in the morning and you have to participate lol.

I loved having Profe as a teacher; he's funny, engaging, and my Spanish fluency has definitely increased in his class. His in-class demeanor is pretty laid back and he's very understanding if you reach out to him. A lot of homework (and tests/quizzes) are done through Connect; make sure you pay attention to that. Put in some work and you'll be fine

He's the best Spanish professor I have ever had! Very hands-on in class and always makes sure we understand something before moving on. He spends lots of time crafting his lesson plans and it really makes a difference when it's time to apply the concepts. He is also very understanding and will give you an extension and accepts excuses for absence.

Profe Alan is a good choice if you're taking Spanish. His class has a decent bit of work, but nothing too serious. He has a lot of projects that we work on and he does a great job at making an online class very hands-on. I enjoyed his class a lot, and am taking another class with him over the summer.

Compared to my previous Spanish teachers and professors, he was really good. Only have had one that could even come close to Prof Watts. I took his online class and he managed to make the learning interactive. If you learn best with projects and video presentations, you will probably like this class. This class was more grammar heavy than vocab.

He seems like a very nice and caring professor. His class is project heavy, with a few quizzes here and there. The assignments took up more time than it should but these assignments serve as a substitute for a test grade. Some positives, that he is willing to work and the time to complete the assignments were always flexible.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--Group projects

comment: He is easily accessible and replies to messages quickly. There is tons of work which would be fine, except that almost every week there is a new platform that you have to learn how to use to be able to do your assignments. It is pretty annoying. It takes up more time than the actual work on the assignments. The quizzes are easy and not proctored.

I took this online and it took up way more time than other classes. He assigned a lot of homework each week on Connect and most of the material was from connect as well. He responds to emails fairly quick and is very understanding.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Accessible outside class

comment: One of my favorite professors ever. I'm amazed at how much my language skills improved in a single semester. Makes class interactive and fun, and gives helpful practice for real-life situations like interviews and debates. Expects your participation. Take him! You won't regret it.

My favorite professor ever! He's super fun and you will learn so much it's hard to believe. He assigns a decent chunk of work, but how else do you learn another language? He is super cool and wants you to do good. Don't be lazy and you'll really enjoy the class. I've taken him for 3 classes, 2 of which were SPAN.

One of the best professors I have ever had. He absolutely loves his job; everyone can see how passionate he is about what he teaches and all of his students. He is so quick to respond to emails and takes every measure he can to make sure his students are understanding the material. Highly recommend taking a class with Prof. Watts!

Professor Watts genuinely wants his students to pass his class and does everything in his power to help the students. He reviews tests after passing them back and is always willing to explain any questions you have. He let us use notes during our exams. He also responds to emails very fast.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria

comment: Watts is an amazing professor he cares about each student and he tries very hard to keep everyone engaged which i appreciate very much! He asked for feedback on his teaching many times and how he can improve! He acknowledges that everyone in the classroom is learning even himself! Want to enjoy your class? Take Watts you wont regret it!

Great teacher! His lectures are amazing and he is a very animated professor. If you are struggling, he is always willing to help. He makes students interact to practice Spanish. He grades on participation so raise your hand often and he offers extra credit as well. Overall, AMAZING PROFESSOR!!!

Prof. Watts is really kind and he makes the class really interactive. Participation and attendance matter (it's 5% of your final grade) and there are a lot of homework assignments on Connect but the class overall is an easy A. I definitely plan on taking him again!

He's a good teacher, does not expect perfection, just that you try your hardest. We graded our own participation/attendance; you fill out this sheet in class and have him sign it at the end. The only critique I have is that I feel like we did not spend a lot of time learning vocab, mostly grammar and culture; vocab sect. on tests were a little hard

Profe Watts is a great teacher! He really wants you to understand. He also mixes up daily activities. Be prepared to work in groups and speak aloud, but it really wasn't bad because he tried to make you as comfortable as possible. He also allowed test corrections which was really helpful.
Profe is such an awesome teacher as he is very understanding and well versed in Spanish. Easy guy to get to know and makes learning Spanish fun! Take him!!!!
This class was so much more work than I expected, but I learned a lot. He's funny and charismatic above all else. This class never gets boring.

LOVE him. Knows his stuff. Super awkward classes at first, because he forces you to interact from the get-go, but ends up being fun and class goes by quickly. Fairly generous grader so long as he sees an effort. I only got a B because I barely did the online homework, due every class day. For sure taking him for all of my language requirements.

Profe Watts is a very nice man and caring professor. He is very knowledgable of Spanish and has traveled extensively. He is funny and is always willing to help. A really admirable aspect of him is that he seems to have a left leaning bent politically but he does not let it seep into his work and thats few and far between nowadays!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Easy interactive Spanish class. He really makes you learn how to speak the language. If you know some Spanish coming in very easy A. Does take attendance but class is always quick and interesting. Take this guy! Homework online on Connect is easy never used the book.
Alan Watts is such a good professor! He challenges you in all that you do. Would definitely take him again.

Second class with profe and he's still a pretty solid professor. Expects participation and strong work ethic. He does move quickly but will explain topics if you ask. Huge group project with shared grades, so beware. Do the hwk. Can seem aloof and cynical, but overall cool guy. I've had lots of Spanish experience so the class was easy to me.
Easy class but a little too easy. We spoke more spanish than english in the class. There's a group film project that's fun but requires a lot of work and a lot of your time.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Profe Watts can seem condescending at times, but you can tell he is passionate about Spanish. He is there to help you when you need it, but if you don't do the work or show you care, he will be less willing to help you. The homework isn't graded, but not doing it won't help you learn the language.

The content isn't easy AND Prof Watts rushes through everything as well. Homework is assigned before going over it in class so you have to teach yourself, guess on the homework and then learn in class. One class per topic. A few quizzes, a few papers with multiple opportunities to correct. End of semester group project. Leaving the class confused.

Loved this class and always looked forward to it. Prof Watts is extremely fluent in Spanish and inspired me to minor in Spanish. With any of these Spanish classes expect to have homework, there will be homework before and after class online. Would recommend and take this class again.

Professor Watts is by far the hardest professor I have had. He only speaks Spanish during class and moves very fast. You have to invest all of your time into his class to be successful. Expect hard tests that he will not look over, group work, and tons of homework. If it was not for the participation grade, I would not have passed his class.

not the easiest grader but you will learn a lot of spanish because of it. he's very understanding and fun to learn from. not an easy A, I'm not a try-hard student and i'm still looking at a B in this class. I could've easily gotten an A had i worked a little harder. talk to him, get on his good side, you'll do great.

You have to study but he was one of my favorite teachers. Spanish is a difficult class but he helps a lot! Homework after every class, but do it. He will check sometimes and that can affect your grade. 4 in class essays but some are with a partner and you take it home to correct. Highly recommend! He knows his stuff and knows how to teach.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: To get an A in the class: - Attend class and PARTICIPATE. Participation is an easy 5% of your grade to get a 100 on - Do all the Connect homework. You have three tries to do well on it - Study for the quizzes - Read the textbook

Worst language teacher I've ever had. I feel like I learned nothing in this class and he did not make things enjoyable. Very strict and a tough grader. If you want to become fluent or at least get a good grade, take another professor.
He's awesome! He cares about students and urges you to do your best! I will take him again. He tries to make class fun. The only negative is a lot of homework.

I really enjoyed Profe as my Span professor. I considered the class an easy A given my 3 years of high school span, but he tries very hard to make the lectures interesting, engaging, and helpful even for those with no experience. Homework is due before every class and it may occasionally be a lot but DO IT. Participation really matters. I recommend

expect homework every night although its not always hard and he usually teaches the material so you know how to do it. only a couple quizzes and one test. quizzes you will need to study for but aren't too long or tricky. He gives out a lot of activities to try and make the class more interesting and changes up his routine for the sake of his studen

This class was probably one of my favorites. He does speak Spanish for most of the class, but he speaks slowly so that we can comprehend. Tests were somewhat difficult but he provides some leniency when grading. The only homework that is graded is what is done on Connect and we were given three attempts. I would take him again.
He is very knowledgable and try to make the class fun. Sometimes the activities get repeatitive. There is lots of homework but it not too bad. There is one group project. I would take him again.
